capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Field Officers must efficiently use resources to maintain and improve park assets, demonstrating a commitment to quality outcomes in environmental conservation.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Officers need to plan daily tasks such as pest and weed control, maintenance, and fire management, adapting to changing circumstances and priorities.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Solving problems in the field, such as responding to visitor enquiries and addressing maintenance issues, requires analytical thinking and practical solutions.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Officers are responsible for their actions, adhering to safety and environmental regulations while proactively addressing risks in park management.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: The role requires self-motivation and a measured approach to work, with a commitment to learning and personal development in environmental conservation.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Respecting diverse backgrounds and perspectives is crucial, especially in working closely with Traditional Owners and the Aboriginal community.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Working as part of a team is essential, requiring collaboration with colleagues, the community, and Traditional Owners in managing the conservation lands.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Effective communication skills are needed for yarning with the community, responding to visitor enquiries, and working within the team.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Understanding and applying effective planning and coordination methods is necessary for the construction and installation of new assets and conservation works.

skills.name: Fire Management
skills.description: Participate in fire management activities, requiring knowledge of fire control and safety procedures.

skills.name: Equipment Operation
skills.description: Operate and maintain a range of plant and equipment, including vehicles and chainsaws, for park maintenance and conservation.

skills.name: Cultural Knowledge
skills.description: Understanding and respecting the cultural significance of Worimi Conservation Lands and working closely with Traditional Owners.

skills.name: Teamwork
skills.description: Ability to work effectively as part of a team, supporting colleagues and collaborating on projects.

skills.name: Problem Solving
skills.description: Identify and resolve issues in the field, from maintenance challenges to visitor enquiries.

generalRole.title: Conservation Field Officer
generalRole.description: This role involves working on conservation lands to maintain and improve environmental assets, manage pests and weeds, and support fire management activities. It requires a blend of technical skills, cultural knowledge, and the ability to work collaboratively with a focus on environmental and cultural conservation.
